common law.translation[0].definitions[0]: the system of laws that has developed from customs and the decisions of judges rather than from laws made by Parliament
common law.translation[1].definitions[0]: according to or related to common law
common law.translation[2].definitions[0]: law that has been developed from common customs and the decisions of judges rather than being decided by an act of Parliament or an act of Congress
Judges may have to develop a common law right to privacy, providing guidance for media regulators.
